page.title: 09THE FREE CHURCH ASHTON
page.content: The church came into being in 1881 with a congregation of around 50 people, some of whom would travel 6 miles from Evesham by horse and cart to join the services. The present Chapel was built in 1923 and this year (1985) the new hall, which replaces a cosy but dilapidated wooden hut, was officially opened. The congregation at present numbers around 90, mainly local inhabitants. Music plays an important part in the worship and on a summer evening many householders stand at their front doors listening to the enthusiastic singing of the congregation. The village is fortunate to have such a lively Christian work, when many Chapels have closed through lack of support and the present generation looks to science and material wealth at the expense of spiritual substance.
